intro: Pseudobombax palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's ceiba, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds covered in a silky, cotton-like fiber. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
